intro: Hornemannia densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered hornemannia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, providing a distinctive texture. Hornemannia densiflora is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive floral display and adaptability to various soil types.
